IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: TO PROVIDE COMMUNITY ASSISTANCE TO DISADVANTAGED YOUTH AND ADULTS.
IRS990.MissionDescription: to promote the independence, citizenry and well-being of individuals and families involved or at risk of involvement in the child welfare, juvenile justice and criminal justice systems.
IRS990.Description: CSIs adult residential division includes inpatient substance abuse treatment programs, treatment with supervised community service, work release, reentry, and transitional residences. Each facility provides structure and supervision, professional services and counseling to clients to enhance their reintegration into the community. CSIs Adult Services Division runs ten residential programs, eight of which are under contract with the Connecticut Department of Corrections (CTDOC). The programs are located in Hartford, Bloomfield, and Waterbury and include work release programs and an inpatient treatment program. Each facility provides structure, supervision, professional services and counseling to clients by using motivational interviewing and evidenced-based programming to enhance reintegration into the community. Male and female clients are referred by the CTDOC, Federal Bureau of Prisons (FBOP), Court Support Services Division (CSSD) and the United States Probation Office and Pretrial Services Office (USPO/PSO). Specialized services include the inpatient substance abuse program at the Berman Treatment Center, the Mothers and Infants Nurturing Together program funded by the FBOP for pregnant and newly post-partum women and the Chase Center where women can keep their children with them while receiving residential substance abuse treatment services.During FY2010, the Female Work Release/Reentry Program at Hartford House had a 92% successful completion rate. During FY2010, the total successful completion rate for all of Adult Residential Programs was 81%.

Activity2.Description: For over a decade, CSI has operated a Community Resource Center (CRC) program in Jersey City, New Jersey, under contract with the New Jersey State Parole Board. This program accepts parole pre-violators and is open for extended, day, evening and weekend hours. Multiple services are provided on-site in this model by highly trained staff including life skills, GED classes, employment readiness, substance abuse treatment and evaluation, parenting, anger management, cognitive behavioral therapy, computer skills group, family therapy, housing referrals, mental health referrals and motivational enhancement therapy. During FY2010, the CRC program had an average utilization of 985 (roughly 82 per month).During FY2010, the CRC program achieved a 70% successful completion rate.

Activity3.Description: Multisystemic Therapy (MST) is an intensive family and community-based treatment service that addresses multiple aspects of serious anti-social behavior in adolescents. The multisystemic approach views an individuals behavior as being influenced by the systems around them, family, peers, school, neighborhood, as systems. MST interventions address the many factors that are known to contribute to delinquency where the youth lives, works and plays. Community Solutions has been delivering MST services for ten years. We are currently the largest provider in the country, delivering services in CT, FL, GA, LA, MD, NJ, PA and RI. The 2010 Discharge Data shows outcomes at; Youth Living at Home 87.3%, Youth Still in School 90.9%, Youth with no new arrest 87.3%. National Average of MST Team Data: Youth Living at Home 84.1%, Youth Still in School 83%, Youth with no new arrest 79.9%.

ActivityOther.Description: CSI also operates youth residential facilities, funtional family therapy (fft), intensive family preservation services, intensive case management services, mst systems supervision services and training.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The 990s for Community Solutions, Inc., Collins Group, Inc. and CSI Connecticut, Inc. (the "Organizations") are reviewed by management to verify amounts agree to internal financial records and to the Consolidated Audited Financial Statements for Community Solutions, Inc. and Subsidiaries. Management reviews all questions and prepares documentation for Form 990. The 990s are then submitted electronically to the Audit Committee Chair of the Board of Directors. The Audit Committee Chair will then submit the 990s to the full Board for review and allow a period of time for feedback and questions. The Audit Committee Chair will then notify management when it is appropriate for the 990s to be submitted.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Conflict of Interest Policy is part of the Personnel Policy Manual, which is issued annually to all employees and to new employees upon hire during orientation. Employees are required to read and sign off that they have received and read the Personnel Policy Manual. Employees from Program Directors to senior management are sent a Conflict of Interest Questionnaire annually and they are required to complete the form and submit it to the V.P. of Administration of Community Solutions, Inc. Any conflicts of interest are investigated by the V.P. of Administration of COmmunity Solutions, Inc.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: EVERY TWO YEARS, THE V.P. OF ADMINISTRATION OBTAINS GUIDESTAR NONPROFIT COMPENSATION REPORT. THIS REPORT IS A NONPROFIT COMPENSATION ANALYSIS BASED ENTIRELY ON IRS DATA. DURING THE FISCAL YEAR 2009, A HUMAN RESOURCE CONSULTANT WAS CONTRACTED TO CONDUCT AN ANALYSIS TO VERIFY THAT THEIR TOP EXECUTIVE POSITIONS, CEO AND SENIOR VICE PRESIDENT, CFO, AND SENIOR MANAGEMENT POSITIONS ARE IN COMPLIANCE WITH IRS REGULATIONS. THE SALARY SURVEY PROPOSAL WAS BASED ON PROVIDING SERVICES TO: 1) REVIEW THE CURRENT JOB DESCRIPTIONS FOR THE ABOVE TWO MENTIONED POSITIONS ENSURING EQUITABLE MATCHES IN THE MARKETPLACE. 2) OBTAIN DEMOGRAPHIC DATA FROM COMMUNITY SOLUTIONS INC. FOR MATCHING THE POSITIONS AGAINST SIMILAR ORGANIZATIONS IN THE MARKETPLACE ON A TOTAL COMPENSATION BASIS, BREAKING OUT BASE AND INCENTIVE COMPENSATION AMOUNTS. 3) UTILIZE COMPENSATION DATA FROM SILMILAR ORGANIZATIONS FOR COMPARISON PURPOSES AGAINST THE TWO POSITIONS. 4) CREATE A SNAPSHOT REPORT INCORPORATING THE MINIMUM, MIDPOINT AND MAXIMUM FOR EACH OF THE POSITIONS IN THE MARKETPLACE. 5) REVIEW SALARIES OF TWO POSITIONS AND COMPARE THOSE SALARIES AGAINST THE MARKETPLACE DATA. LOOK AT BOTH BASE COMPENSATION AND INCENTIVE COMPENSATION PAID. 6)DETERMINE WHETHER THE SALARIES MEET THE INTERMEDIATE SANCTIONS TEST AND CERTIFY FOR THE ORGANIZATION.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Governing documents are made available upon request. The Conflict of Interest Policy is part of the Personnel Policy Manual, which is issued annually to all employees and to new employees upon hire during orientation and is made available upon request. Annually, following the Board of Directors approval, the Consolidated Audited Financial Statements for Community Solutions, Inc. and Subsidiaries are submitted to funding sources and the bank and are made available upon request. Form 990 is also available through Guidestar.org.
